intro: Gouffeia holosteoides, commonly known as the African water lily, is a tropical aquatic plant native to Africa. It typically grows in shallow freshwater habitats such as ponds and slow-moving streams. The plant features broad, floating leaves that provide shade and oxygen to the water. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, with a distinctive, cup-like structure. Gouffeia holosteoides plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by supporting various aquatic life forms.
